senses.sense_definition: The group of seven small bones in the human foot situated between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, forming the ankle and heel.

examples.text: The athlete suffered a fracture in the <w>tarsus</w> after landing awkwardly from a jump.
Anatomy students must memorize the names of every bone in the <w>tarsus</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The final segment of the leg of an insect or other arthropod, typically consisting of several small parts and ending in a claw.

examples.text: Under the microscope, the beetle's <w>tarsus</w> revealed tiny hooks used for gripping surfaces.
The number of segments in the <w>tarsus</w> can help identify the species of the insect.

senses.sense_definition: The shank of the leg in a bird or reptile, located between the thigh and the toes.

examples.text: The eagle has a powerful <w>tarsus</w> covered in thick protective scales.
Ornithologists measure the length of the <w>tarsus</w> to gather data on bird growth.

senses.sense_definition: A plate of dense connective tissue inside the eyelid that gives it shape and support.

examples.text: Inflammation of the <w>tarsus</w> can cause significant discomfort in the upper eyelid.
The surgeon repaired the damaged <w>tarsus</w> to restore the natural contour of the eye.

senses.sense_definition: A historic city in southeastern Turkey, known as an important center of Cilicia in antiquity and the birthplace of Paul the Apostle.

examples.text: Many tourists visit <w>Tarsus</w> to see the ancient Roman gate and historical wells.
Saint Paul of <w>Tarsus</w> is one of the most famous figures in early Christian history.
